page.title: 17MAYPOLE DANCING
page.content: Annually, pupils of Hetton Lyons Primary School participate in the ancient custom of{Maypole Dancing.}A Mayqueen and her attendants are chosen for this special event and pupils train to perfect dances such as {"The Plait"}and{"The Spiders Web". The procession begins at the school. Mr. J. H. Piper transports the Mayqueen and her attendants in his green 1929 2_litre Lagonda. As they lead the procession Houghton Schools Band and school children follow behind. An arrival at Hetton Centre, the Maypole dancing begins to be watched by an appreciative audience. Money is also collected for{charities.}In 1984 it was used to purchase and train a guide dog. Through this annual event several people and groups in the community have been helped.
